
{{alias}}( [out,] x[, y[, ...args]] )
    Returns the minimum and maximum absolute values.

    If any argument is `NaN`, the function returns `NaN` for both the minimum
    and maximum absolute values.

    Parameters
    ----------
    out: Array|TypedArray|Object (optional)
        Output object.

    x: number
        First number.

    y: number (optional)
        Second number.

    args: ...number (optional)
        Numbers.

    Returns
    -------
    out: Array|TypedArray|Object
        Minimum and maximum absolute values.

    Examples
    --------
    > var v = {{alias}}( 3.14, 4.2 )
    [ 3.14, 4.2 ]
    > v = {{alias}}( -5.9, 3.14, 4.2 )
    [ 3.14, 5.9 ]
    > v = {{alias}}( 3.14, NaN )
    [ NaN, NaN ]
    > v = {{alias}}( +0.0, -0.0 )
    [ 0.0, 0.0 ]
    > v = {{alias}}( 3.14 )
    [ 3.14, 3.14 ]
    > var out = [ 0.0, 0.0 ];
    > v = {{alias}}( out, 3.14 )
    [ 3.14, 3.14 ]
    > var bool = ( v === out )
    true

    See Also
    --------
